page.title: 12The village of Skeeby
page.content: At the foot of Hall Farm drive there is a barn which is being made into a modern bungalow.The village hall was made from two old cottages. Halfe Hill House was also a farm building. Rose Cottage was once a granary. There is only one shop and the prices are rather high compared with town shops.It is also the Post Office. It is an attracive village with a rising spring beck flowing alongside the main road edge by the village green. The most annoying aspect of living in Skeeby is the speed and intensity of the traffic at certain times of day.Also the rates are very high and services poor.There is a small street of council houses and old peoples bungalows.The houses are having their foundations strengthened.
